Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so REKT1 will be combined testing of sidechain gateways CC, prices CC and snapshot payments CC and will create what i think is one of the first fully automated money making system that distributes automatically to the stakeholders

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c What should be the setup for side chains, we talked that there should be minimal funds on side chain and minimal mining reward so that it does not influence the number of coins?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, -ac_end=1 would be required, if not set then it should abort at startup

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: -ac_supply must also be 0

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it also needs -earlytxid so if that is not set, also startshutdown

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ok, didn't know about -ac_end...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there will be a small number of coins generated still due to magic calcs for testing and issuing the initial tx

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, we need some coins for initial bind tx. But don't forget also for oracle publishers!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i heard it said that there are a "ridiculous number of -ac options"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, i think around 10 coins will be issued

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Well, now when I look komodo_globals.h, maybe it is true üòÑ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which wont be any issue for any chain other than BTC

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So what does ac_end do?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for such chains, we just need to rely on chain creator to burn any excess after all is in place, though having to pay 0,0001 BTC per tx changes the "tx are basically free" concept

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ac_end stops mining rewards at that height

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Aha

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So where does the txfee go?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: miners

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: To the miners, they have just txfee?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ok

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which for BTC sidechain might actually get some decent hashrate

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 50 cents per tx...

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So when everything is set, the oraclepublishers should never get out of funds. They will be miners and publishers?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Or if there are other miners, then they can get out of funds?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes its true

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess a BTC sidechain might need some special rules

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: lets not do it!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: BTC would be via token only, then none of it is lost to txfees

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD sidechain, is ok as chain creator can just fund the oracles with enough KMD to pay for the txfees

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 0.1 KMD per day?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Depending on how much publishers there is.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, we would want to collect the rewards from the deposits

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so that is some additional oraclefeed thing to do later. consolidating utxo and collecting rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the former useful for all gateways

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: In case of lets say 10 publishers. 1440*10ksat * 10 publishers= 1.4 KMD per day if my calc is right

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: 0.14 per publisher per day

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we dont need all to be publishing every block

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: we need at least n/2 to have publishing

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: But to be sure it is working it must be more (if some is down)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess it is a cost we need to pay. 500 KMD per year

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if 100,000 is deposited, it will be from rewards. ok, that works assuming we can collecte the msig rewards

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: The msig should basically pay it self, the marker for msig is spent on last markdonetx for tx fee.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: On withdraw it is created and spent in every sign tx and then spent for txfee in markdone.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Deposit tx in case of sidechains does not have any markers and txfee either as it is import tx.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So it is selfcontained system. The only cost is the tx fee of withdraw and msig signing.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oracles seems the main cost

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe we make it so that the oracles tx on the sidechain are free?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yeah, that is the cost of maintaining the system

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think @blackjok8r made some free tx possible in the miners for notarization, but if ( KOMODO_SIDECHAIN != 0 && valid oracletx )

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then the miners will mine oracle txid without txfee, or if some txfee is needed for the CC logic, some really small amount

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So to summarize ac params, beside ac_import, ac_end=1 and ac_supply=0 should be set, anything else that should exit the daemon if not set?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ac_perc needs to be 0 too

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we need to test to make sure only txfees go to miners

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So the ac_perc should also be added to shutdown condition or is already added somewhere?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: should be added, there is no special detect for sidechain shutdown conditions, you are writing the first

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the ac options setting is really not so complex, there are just so many of them

Content: -0.5765208893219 % loss but at 100x leverage that is 57.6% loss of equity

Content: rekt would be if you go below 10% of (positionsize + addedbets)

Content: `  "profits": 0.00000000,`  should be profits kinda -57.6 on this point?
